channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Half of Americans think ICE is making cities less safe, poll finds – live
item.description: Fifty-six percent of Americans said fatal shooting of Renee Good was an inappropriate use of force, survey by CNN finds Donald Trump repeated his thre...

item.title: Anti-Trump US reporter says she was offered job at ICE after ‘minimal vetting’
item.description: Slate journalist Laura Jedeed documented hiring process and said she got offer despite not completing paperwork A reporter has become embroiled in a p...

item.title: Australia news live: data hack on Victorian public schools; SA premier defends criticism of Randa Abdel-Fattah
item.description: Peter Malinauskas says he has done what he thinks ‘is right’ in his handling of the Adelaide writers’ week fallout. Follow updates live Get our breaki...

item.title: US acquisition of Greenland ‘absolutely not necessary,’ Danish foreign minister says after ‘frank’ talks with JD Vance – Europe live
item.description: Lars Løkke Rasmussen acknowledges ‘new security situation’ in the Arctic but says US control is not the answer after brief meeting in Washington This ...

item.title: Donald Trump says he has been told the ‘killing in Iran is stopping’ – live
item.description: US president says it has ‘just gotten to me’ that ‘they’re not going to have an execution’ as he addresses reporters over the death sentence of protes...

item.title: Mahmood has no confidence in police chief after Israeli fan ban
item.description: West Midlands Police apologises for errors, but makes no comment on its chief constable's future.

item.title: Why banning of Maccabi fans raises questions about police integrity
item.description: The decision to ban fans of the Israeli team from a UK game was based on a flawed assessment, a report has found.

item.title: White House defends Trump over middle-finger gesture at heckler
item.description: Thousands of people have sent donations totalling nearly $700,000 (£521,000) to the heckler, who was suspended from his job at Ford.

item.title: California investigates Grok over AI deepfakes
item.description: The state attorney general urges xAI to take action over the "shocking" material as Musk denies the allegations.

item.title: US launches phase two of Gaza peace plan with new technocratic government
item.description: It includes the establishment of a technocratic Palestinian government, as well as the reconstruction and demilitarisation of Gaza, US envoy Steve Wit...
